Summary: Federal Government may be on course to miss the 2026 budget entirely . Presidency seeking to consolidate the 2024 and 2025 appropriation . Tax reforms pushback, revenue crisis threaten 2026 fiscal plan .

Title: Fault lines threaten constitutional reforms consensus as Reps vote today
Summary: Nigeria’s most far-reaching constitutional review since 1999 reaches a decisive moment today as lawmakers vote on electoral reforms . Nigeria's constitution review is Nigeria's first since 1999 .

Title: Kefas: A quiet defection long foretold in Taraba politics
Summary: Agbu Kefas defected from the embattled Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) to the ruling All Progressives Congress (APC) Taraba State Governor, Agbu . State Governor . Agbu is a former Governor of the PDP .

Title: Troops repel terrorists’ drone attack in Borno, rescue kidnapped Benue victim
Summary: Troops repel terrorists’ drone attack in Borno, rescue kidnapped Benue victim . Terrorists deployed four armed drones with explosives but were successfully neutralised by the troops .

Title: UBA partners CIG Motors, Lagride, launches $100m vehicle financing scheme
Summary: United Bank for Africa (UBA) Plc has announced a $100 million financing partnership scheme with CIG Motors, Lagride and Lagos State Government . The scheme is aimed at redefining urban mobility and promoting financial inclusion in Nigeria . UBA will be the key financier, offering loan subscriptions .

Title: Fish output jumps to 1.4m tonnes as FG intensifies blue economy push
Summary: Nigeria’s local fish production has increased to 1.4m metric tonnes from 1.1m tonnes this year . Minister of Marine and Blue Economy, Adegboyega Oyetola, disclosed this in Abuja at the 4th Quarter Quarter .

Title: Arrest, prosecute those funding insecurity, Labour demands; protests across states
Summary: FG must urgently deploy ‘the full machinery of governance’ to reclaim communities, protect workers and restore public confidence . Arrest, prosecute those funding insecurity, Labour demands; protests across states .

Title: 21-year-old English club forward dies in car crash
Summary: Macclesfield FC forward Ethan McLeod died in a road accident on Tuesday night . The 21-year-old was travelling back from Bedford Town when he was involved in a car accident on the M1 . The club described McLeod as a key member of its first-team squad and paid tribute to his ability and character .

Title: Tinubu hosts Niger Delta leaders, vows to defeat terrorism, banditry
Summary: President Bola Tinubu spoke to leaders of the Ogbia community of Bayelsa State . He pledged that his government would sustain the push against violent groups while expanding development interventions in the Niger Delta . The President’s latest pledge came as communities continue to battle insurgency, banditry, kidnappings and attacks .

Title: Carabao Cup semis: City face Newcastle, Chelsea await Arsenal or Palace
Summary: The English Football League has released the draw for the Carabao Cup semi-finals . Holders Newcastle United will face Manchester City, while Chelsea will play the winners of the quarter-final tie between Arsenal and Crystal Palace . Title: EU pledges deeper security cooperation with Nigeria
Summary: The EU Ambassador to Nigeria and ECOWAS, Mr Gautier Mignot, paid a courtesy visit to the Chief of Defence Staff, General Olufemi Oluyede at the Defence Headquarters in Abuja . Title: Textile imports hit N814bn despite govt revival promises
Summary: Nigeria imported textile and textile articles worth N228.83bn in first quarter of 2025, N337.12bn in second quarter, and N248.32bn in third quarter .
